comments:

Created an attachment (id=81781)
My .log file

My installation is pretty fresh so there isn't much here. The last 3 stackdumps show the problem. It occurred on 10-31-2007

Oh, I forgot to mention this. The exceptions were OutOfMemory exceptions. But, it isn't due to insufficient memory to run Eclipse. My machine has 2GB of RAM which should be plenty...right? I don't have the exact steps to duplicate yet. But, I will pass them on when I get them.

PermGen-related out of memory errors are very common with larger Eclipse installs and certain JREs.  It isn't the same as regular out of memory errors.  Eclipse 3.3.1 doesn't increase the PermGen size properly (hence the recent 3.3.1.1).  You can increase the maximum PermGen size yourself by launching WTP with VM argument: -XX:MaxPermSize=128M.  The full command line arguments can be found at http://help.eclipse.org/stable/topic/org.eclipse.platform.doc.user/tasks/running_eclipse.htm
